title: Was Anthony Taylor's decision to award Chelsea a penalty 'farcical'?
description: Contrary to Arsene Wenger's thoughts, Jamie Carragher and Thierry Henry believe the decision to award a penalty to Chelsea after Hector Bellerin's tackle on Eden Hazard was correct.
content: Wenger labelled Anthony Taylor's decision "farcical" as the champions were handed a route back into the thrilling 2-2 draw at the Emirates Stadium, four minutes after Jack Wilshere's opener."We got again a farcical decision and mentally we were shocked," the Gunners boss told Sky Sports.Having agreed with Wenger's analysis on first viewing, on second glance, co-commentator Gary Neville changed his mind to back the referee's decision."It looks like a penalty from the referee's angle," he said. "If you go for a challenge like that as a defender and don't make contact with the ball you're asking for trouble."And, speaking after the game, pundits Carragher and Henry seconded Neville's assessment of Taylor's awarding of a penalty.Hit the video at the top of the story for an in-depth look after one of the key talking points from the thrilling Emirates encounter...
